metadata.title: CVE-2017-9763 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The grub_ext2_read_block function in fs/ext2.c in GNU GRUB before2013-11-12, as used in shlr/grub/fs/ext2.c in radare2 1.5.0, allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (excessive stack use and applicationcrash) via a crafted binary file, related to use of a variable-size stackarray.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-common - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-coreboot - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-coreboot-bin - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-efi - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-efi-amd64 - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-efi-arm - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-efi-arm-bin - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-efi-ia32 - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-efi-ia32-bin - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-emu - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-firmware-qemu - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-ieee1275 - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-ieee1275-bin - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-linuxbios - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-pc - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-pc-bin - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-rescue-pc - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-theme-starfield - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-uboot - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-uboot-bin - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-xen - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-xen-bin - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub-xen-host - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub2 - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
grub2-common - 2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: grub2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.02~beta2-36ubuntu3.12').
radare2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
